positive_indicators.statement: I felt excited about starting my day.
I found it easy to focus on tasks I care about.
I put off things I wanted or needed to do.
I felt proud of completing small goals.
I had clear reasons for what I was doing.
I enjoyed learning or trying new things.
I kept going even when tasks were difficult.
I needed others to push me to take action.
I felt inspired by something or someone.
I struggled to start tasks even when I had time.
I followed through on what I planned.
I felt a sense of purpose or direction.
I avoided things that felt challenging.
I celebrated small wins or progress.

depression_indicators.statement: I felt down, sad, or hopeless.
I had little interest or pleasure in doing things.
I felt tired or had little energy.
My sleep was poor (too much or too little).
I found it hard to concentrate on things.
I felt emotionally numb or disconnected.
I avoided social contact or withdrew from others.
I felt that life had little meaning.
I struggled to make simple decisions.
I felt restless or slowed down physically.
I noticed negative thoughts repeating in my mind.
I found it hard to feel joy even in positive moments.
I felt that small tasks took a lot of effort.

anxiety_indicators.statement: I felt tense, nervous, or on edge.
I worried about many different things.
I found it hard to relax.
I felt a sense of dread or fear without clear reason.
I noticed my heart racing or breathing faster.
I felt easily startled or jumpy.
I struggled to stop or control worrying.
I avoided situations that made me nervous.
I had trouble sleeping because of racing thoughts.
I feared something bad might happen.
I replayed stressful situations in my mind.
I felt dizzy, sweaty, or shaky during stress.
I needed reassurance from others often.
I felt anxious even in safe or calm settings.
